page.title: 05THE THEATRE
page.content: On the afternoon of Saturday March 6th 1926 the original Memorial Theatre went up in flames.This theatre is one of the main tourists attractions in Stratford.Outside the door there is a stone laid by the Lord Ampthill the most worshipful Pro Grand master of the United Grand Lodge of England on the 2nd July 1929 to commemorate the rebuilding of the Shakespeare Memorial Theatre.People come from far and near to see plays like Macbeth.The Royal Shakespeare Company of Stratford put on most the productions.Seats cost anything from Â£4 to Â£15.There are about 6 productions a year.The first productions for 1985/86 season are Merry Wives of Windsor,As You Like It, Troilus and Cressida.Nowadays theres a restaurant where people can go after the performance to eat and there is also a bar upstairs near a gift shop.
